Worlds.name: ChineseMyth
Worlds.description: The cosmological system of Chinese mythology, encompassing celestial guardians, terrestrial beasts, divine hybrids, and primordial entities that govern cosmic balance, seasons, elements, and human fortune.

cosmology.heavenly_realms: Nine Heavens (九天), Celestial Bureaucracy, Jade Emperor's Court
cosmology.terrestrial_realms: Four Seas, Sacred Mountains, Yellow Springs, Mortal World
cosmology.underworld: Diyu (十八层地狱) - 18 Levels of Hell, Fengdu Ghost City

series.name: The Four Celestial Guardians (四象)
series.origin: Ancient Chinese astronomy and cosmology, representing four constellations and directions
series.purpose: Guard the cosmos, regulate seasons and elements, maintain celestial-terrestrial balance

characters.name: Qinglong
title: Celestial Emperor of the East
Governor of Spring and Wood
Bearer of the Cosmic Compass
Ancestor of All Terrestrial Dragons
characters.constellation: Azure Dragon of the East (东方青龙座) - 7 Mansions

head.eyes: Molten gold eyes shaped like solar crescents, perceiving celestial qi flows and mortal fortunes. Radiate both wisdom and ancient authority.
head.nose: Prominent with flaring nostrils exhaling spring mists. Bridge adorned with vine-like patterns symbolizing wood element.
head.ears: Large fin-like, semi-translucent ears attuned to Eastern prayers and cosmic vibrations. Constantly monitoring Jupiter's movements.
head.extra_facial_features: Long flowing whiskers sensitive to weather changes. Beard of shimmering azure threads. Intelligent brow ridge. Pearl of condensed wisdom resting on tongue.

body.chest: Serpentine torso with 81 major jade-azure scales (9x9 completion). Each scale inscribed with Eastern star maps. Pulsating heart-orb of spring energy. Cobalt-silver mane flows from head to spine.
body.arms: Four limbs with five-clawed imperial paws (obsidian claws). Forelimbs often grasp Pearl of Wisdom or Seal of the East.

lower_body.legs: Coiling form transitioning seamlessly or powerful leonine legs. Tail whip-like with typhoon-stirring tuft. Treads on Pathmaking Clouds (Xiangyun).
lower_body.special_features: Body length varies from 30 feet to 300 miles when manifesting fully. Scales change hue with seasons from pale green (early spring) to deep azure (late spring).

armor_costume.head: Eastern Directional Talisman - green jade disc with Bagua inscription floating above head, emitting ward against evil and regulating seasons.

armor_costume.torso: Stellar Heartguard - dense scales around heart glowing with seven major stars of its constellation. Natural armor of celestial bronze-jade composite.

armor_costume.arms: Cloud Bracers - ethereal bands of mist and lightning that solidify. Claws sheathed in Yang-energy effective against ghosts.

armor_costume.legs: Pathmaking Clouds - self-materializing transport clouds colored azure-silver, part of its celestial being.

armor_costume.celestial_regalia: Azure Emperor's Scepter - aged living peach wood staff from Queen Mother's gardens, topped with spinning destiny compass pointing East.

divine_artifacts.name: Spring Emergence Pearl
divine_artifacts.description: A pearl formed from the first sunrise of creation, residing in its throat. Contains the essence of growth and new beginnings.

divine_artifacts.name: Dragon-Seal of the Eastern Heaven
divine_artifacts.description: A square jade seal granted by Jade Emperor, authorizing its governance over Eastern territories and spring administration.

abilities.name: Cosmic Season Weaving
abilities.short_description: Governs celestial mechanics of Spring and Wood element globally.
abilities.full_description: Breath initiates spring equinox. Controls germination, sap rising, plant growth. Emotional state influences spring storm intensity. Can accelerate growth (forests in moments) or reverse blight within Eastern domain.
abilities.activation: Automatic with celestial position, enhanced by focused will
abilities.limitations: Power diminishes outside Eastern quadrant; requires celestial bureaucracy approval for major deviations
abilities.visual_effects: Verdant energy waves, sprouting flora in wake, seasonal light shifts

abilities.name: Storm Sovereignty
abilities.short_description: Absolute command over rains, winds, thunder, benevolent weather.
abilities.full_description: Summons life-giving rains or pollen-spreading breezes. At full power: Dragon's Wake Typhoon - directed storm cleansing corruption. Roar becomes thunder, scale-clash creates lightning, tail-waving gathers clouds.
abilities.limitations: Must maintain cosmic balance; cannot cause unjust destruction without heavenly censure
abilities.visual_effects: Cloud formation from body, rain falling from whiskers, lightning from scales

abilities.name: Astral Projection & Geomancy
abilities.full_description: Spirit form mapped onto Eastern constellations. Projects to inspect territories or bless dragon-veins (Lung Mei). Expert in cosmic-scale Feng Shui; flight paths determine beneficial qi flow. Can raise mountains or divert rivers to correct geomancy.
abilities.limitations: Bound by natural laws of geomancy; cannot create permanent changes without terrestrial spirit consent
abilities.visual_effects: Ghostly astral dragon form, visible ley lines, mountain-shifting tremors

abilities.name: Divine Draconic Authority
abilities.short_description: Commands respect/obedience from all lesser dragon spirits.
abilities.full_description: Presence suppresses chaotic flood dragons (Jiaolong) and river spirits. Lesser rain deities are its vassals. Aura calms raging waters or compels dragon obedience to celestial mandate.
abilities.activation: Passive aura, intensified by display of regalia
abilities.limitations: Weakened against renegade dragons with independent cult followings
abilities.visual_effects: Pressure waves causing lesser dragons to bow, water surfaces stilling

characters.cultivation_level: Primordial Celestial (先天神) - born divine, no cultivation needed
notable_stories: Helped Yellow Emperor defeat Chi You by controlling weather
Annual battle with White Tiger to maintain seasonal transition balance

characters.name: Zhuque
title: Celestial Empress of the South
Governor of Summer and Fire
Solar Ambassador
Ancestor of All Phoenix-kind
characters.constellation: Vermilion Bird of the South (南方朱雀座) - 7 Mansions

appearance.head: Majestic bird with five-colored plumage (primary vermilion). Phoenix crown of flames. Eyes like burning coals. Beak of polished coral that glows with inner fire.
appearance.body: Plumage patterns resemble flowing lava and solar flares. Tail feathers trail celestial fire. Wingspan creates rainbow halos.
appearance.special_features: Constantly surrounded by harmless nimbus of flame. Tears are molten pearls. Song causes plants to fruit.

abilities.name: Solar Resonance
abilities.description: Channels and amplifies sun's energy. Can intensify sunlight or create miniature suns.

abilities.name: Rebirth from Ashes
abilities.description: Immortal cycle of death and rebirth every 500 years, emerging stronger.

notable_stories: Companion to Queen Mother of West

characters.name: Baihu
title: Celestial General of the West
Governor of Autumn and Metal
Executioner of Celestial Law
King of Mountain Beasts
characters.constellation: White Tiger of the West (西方白虎座) - 7 Mansions

appearance.head: Fierce tiger with fur white as fresh snow. Stripes are metallic silver that sharpen to blade-edges. Eyes glacial blue with slit pupils. Fangs of crystalline quartz.
appearance.body: Muscular frame with metallic sheen. Claws extend/retract like steel blades. Tail tipped with spiked metal ball.
appearance.special_features: Roar shreds metal. Paws leave frost patterns. Presence causes weapons to resonate.

abilities.name: Weapon Mastery Aura
abilities.description: All metal weapons within range become sharper, never break.

abilities.name: Executioner's Gaze
abilities.description: Can discern guilt and impose celestial punishment through directed will.

characters.name: Xuanwu
title: Celestial Chancellor of the North
Governor of Winter and Water
Bearer of World Mountain
Master of Longevity
characters.constellation: Black Tortoise of the North (北方玄武座) - 7 Mansions

appearance.head: Composite being: tortoise body with snake coiled around it/twin heads. Tortoise head: wise, ancient eyes, beak of obsidian. Snake head: vigilant, forked tongue tasting fate.
appearance.body: Tortoise shell inscribed with universe map and celestial calendar. Shell patterns shift with constellations. Snake body scales are black jade.
appearance.special_features: Moves with glacial slowness but instant teleportation ability. Shell contains microcosm.

abilities.name: Cosmic Endurance
abilities.description: Can bear infinite weight. Shell protects against any attack given time to prepare.

abilities.name: Water Memory
abilities.description: Remembers everything that has ever been reflected in water; oracle of past/future.

notable_stories: Supports world on back in some myths
Adviser to Yu the Great during flood control

series.name: The Four Perils (四凶)
series.origin: Exiled by sage-kings for embodying fundamental vices and chaos
series.purpose: Test humanity's virtue, represent cosmic imbalances that must be contained

characters.name: Hundun
title: Embodiment of Pre-Creation
The Uncarved Block
Blissful Ignorance Incarnate

appearance.head: NO DISTINCT FEATURES - A fleshy, sack-like being with no facial orifices. Surface smooth like unborn egg. Color shifts between fog-gray and deep void black.
appearance.body: Amorphous blob that changes shape. No limbs or defined anatomy. Sometimes depicted with six legs and wings but no head (contradictory forms).
appearance.special_features: Absorbs light and sound nearby. Reality warps subtly around it. Cannot perceive or interact with world conventionally.

characters.nature_paradox: Kind to the good (who appreciate chaos as potential), attacks the wicked (who fear disorder). Represents both creative potential and destructive confusion.

abilities.name: Conceptual Inversion
abilities.description: Inverts cause-effect, logic, and perception in vicinity. Makes organized plans fall apart, but also inspires breakthroughs from chaos.

abilities.name: Blissful Ignorance Field
abilities.description: Suppresses sensory input and higher thought. Creates state of contented, thoughtless existence.

characters.defeat_method: Died when well-meaning friends bored holes for senses (giving it perception which destroyed its chaotic nature).
characters.symbolic_meaning: The danger of imposing order where chaos is natural; the value of unformed potential.

characters.name: Taotie
title: Embodiment of Excess
Feast Demon
Consumer of Worlds

appearance.head: Often depicted as frontal mask only: bulging eyes, gaping mouth with fangs, no lower jaw. When fully formed: corpulent humanoid with mouth covering abdomen.
appearance.body: Massive distended stomach that's never full. Hands constantly grasping. Skin covered in food stains and precious material remnants.
appearance.special_features: Can consume anything material or spiritual. The more it eats, the larger its hunger grows exponentially.

abilities.name: All-Consuming Maw
abilities.description: Can devour objects, energy, memories, even abstract concepts like 'time' or 'hope' if focused.

abilities.name: Feast Mirage
abilities.description: Creates illusions of boundless banquets to lure victims.

characters.symbolic_meaning: Warning against greed, consumerism, excess. Common decoration on bronze vessels to remind of moderation.

characters.name: Taowu
title: Embodiment of Ignorance
Willful Fool
Anti-Wisdom

appearance.head: Tiger-like with boar tusks and dull, uncomprehending eyes. Human ears that hear but don't process. Permanent confused snarl.
appearance.body: Muscular but clumsy frame. Covered in unhealed wounds from refusing to learn danger. Tail like barbed club.
appearance.special_features: Aura of confusion that muddles complex thoughts. Knowledge dissipates near it.

abilities.name: Knowledge Nullification
abilities.description: Creates field where education, reason, and wisdom fail. Complex strategies simplify to brute force.

abilities.name: Inexorable Charge
abilities.description: Once set on path, cannot be reasoned or diverted. Gains momentum ignoring obstacles.

characters.symbolic_meaning: Danger of willful ignorance, refusal to learn, anti-intellectualism.

characters.name: Qiongqi
title: Embodiment of Betrayal
Patron of Villains
Rewarder of Wickedness

appearance.head: Winged tiger with ox tail or ox-like body with tiger stripes. Eyes that reflect opposite of reality (good appears repulsive). Smirk of malicious amusement.
appearance.body: Wings of tattered justice. Fur pattern forms mocking faces. Claws tipped with poison that rewards evil deeds.
appearance.special_features: Sees moral alignment inverted. Drawn to acts of betrayal.

abilities.name: Moral Inversion
abilities.description: Rewards wicked acts with power/fortune, punishes good deeds with misfortune. Actively seeks to corrupt.

abilities.name: Betrayal Empowerment
abilities.description: Grows stronger from acts of treachery nearby. Can sense loyalties to exploit.

characters.notable_behavior: Devours good people on command of evil ones, brings criminals gifts from gods.
characters.symbolic_meaning: Ultimate perversion of justice, cosmic unfairness, betrayal as fundamental evil.

series.name: Celestial Ministry Beasts
series.origin: Beasts serving in celestial bureaucracy or as divine omens
series.purpose: Assist heavenly administration, act as divine messengers, embody specific virtues

characters.name: Qilin
title: Herald of Sage-Kings
Embodiment of Perfect Virtue
Walking Auspice

appearance.head: Dragon-like with antlers (usually two), kind eyes showing infinite compassion. Beard of silk threads. Mouth small, rarely opens.
appearance.body: Deer body with ox tail, horse hooves. Scales like fish on belly, fur on back. Single horn (male) or no horn (female) with flesh tip (cannot harm).
appearance.color: Multi-colored but never garish - soft pastels that shift. Often white as base.
appearance.special_features: Walks on clouds without disturbing grass. Steps create lotus blossoms. Voice like wind chimes.

characters.divine_purpose: Appears only during reign of wise rulers or before birth/death of great sages (Confucius' mother dreamt of one).

abilities.name: Divine Judgement
abilities.description: Can discern pure hearts. Will gore the wicked with its harmless horn (psychic punishment).

abilities.name: Fertility Blessing
abilities.description: Presence ensures healthy offspring and abundant harvests.

characters.symbolic_meaning: Perfect virtue, benevolent rule, miraculous birth, protection of children.

characters.name: Pixiu
title: Guardian of Treasures
Wealth Attractor
Imperial Protector

appearance.head: Lion-like with dragon features. Wide mouth, sharp teeth, single horn (male) or two horns (female). Fierce but loyal expression.
appearance.body: Winged lion body. No anus (key feature). Often depicted sitting on gold ingots or with coin in mouth.
appearance.special_features: Cannot excrete - wealth only enters. Wings allow travel between material and spiritual realms for treasure.

characters.divine_purpose: Protects wealth, attracts fortune, guards against financial loss, wards off evil spirits seeking riches.

abilities.name: Wealth Magnetism
abilities.description: Attracts gold, silver, jewels from surroundings. Prevents wealth from leaving premises.

abilities.name: Evil Wealth Detection
abilities.description: Can discern ill-gotten gains and refuse them.

characters.cultural_significance: Popular in feng shui and business. Statues face outward to attract wealth, inward to guard it.

characters.name: Bai Ze
title: Knower of 11,520 Supernaturals
Imperial Advisor on Spirits
Walking Bestiary

appearance.head: Lion-like with goat beard, single or multiple horns. Eyes that see all forms. Mouth capable of human speech.
appearance.body: White fur with blue patterns mapping supernatural realms. Often seated in scholarly pose.
appearance.special_features: Forehead eye that sees true forms. Knowledge manifests as glowing script on fur.

characters.divine_purpose: Appeared to Yellow Emperor to catalog all supernatural beings and how to counter them. Basis for Chinese demonology.

abilities.name: Omniscient Bestiary
abilities.description: Knows name, appearance, habits, and weaknesses of every supernatural creature.

abilities.name: Exorcism Protocols
abilities.description: Can teach proper rituals to ward off or banish any entity.

characters.legacy: Its teachings compiled into lost 'Bai Ze Tu' (Bai Ze Charts) used by exorcists for millennia.

characters.name: Xiezhi
title: Living Scales of Justice
Divine Arbiter
Bane of Liars

appearance.head: Goat-lion-ox hybrid. Single straight horn on forehead that glows in presence of falsehood. Eyes see through deception.
appearance.body: Lean muscular build. Often depicted in courtroom settings. Ancient Han dynasty judges wore Xiezhi hats.
appearance.special_features: Horn vibrates near lies. Can't be in presence of injustice without acting.

characters.divine_purpose: Attends celestial court proceedings. In ancient times, released in courtrooms to gore the guilty.

abilities.name: Unerring Truth Detection
abilities.description: Cannot be fooled by any deception, magical or mundane. Sees intent, not just words.

abilities.name: Compelled Confession
abilities.description: Presence forces guilty parties to confess under spiritual pressure.

characters.symbolic_meaning: Divine justice, incorruptible judgement, truth as fundamental cosmic principle.

characters.name: Zouyu
title: Omen of Perfect Governance
Moral Carnivore
Peace Guardian

appearance.head: White tiger with black stripes forming righteous text patterns. Gentle eyes. Mouth that never shows fangs.
appearance.body: Powerful but graceful. Moves silently. Claws retracted unless performing divine duty.
appearance.special_features: Only eats winter-growing plants. Leaves no tracks. Glows softly with virtuous light.

characters.divine_purpose: Appears only during reigns of perfectly virtuous rulers (vanishes with first sign of corruption).

abilities.name: Virtue Resonance
abilities.description: Senses moral character of rulers from miles away. Drawn to benevolence, repelled by corruption.

abilities.name: Selective Hunting
abilities.description: Only hunts when fulfilling celestial mandate against evil beings. Otherwise strictly herbivorous.

characters.historical_record: Reported during reigns of legendary sage-kings Yao and Shun.

series.name: Transformative & Legendary Beasts
series.era: Various, from Zhuangzi (Warring States) to folklore
series.origin: Philosophical metaphors, folk tales, regional legends
series.purpose: Illustrate philosophical concepts, explain natural phenomena, embody human aspirations

characters.name: Kun / Peng
title: Embodiment of Potential
Being of Two Natures
Symbol of Perspective

appearance.kun_form: Fish thousands of miles long. Dorsal fin like mountain range. Scales like continental plates. Eyes like deep sea trenches.
appearance.peng_form: Bird with wings like clouds across sky. Back measures thousands of miles. Feathers like celestial banners. Shadow darkens entire regions.
appearance.transformation: Metamorphosis involves mist, storms, and reality-warping as fish becomes bird.

characters.origin_story: Central parable in Zhuangzi's 'Free and Easy Wandering' illustrating relativity and transformation.
characters.philosophical_meaning: What seems enormous from one perspective (Kun in northern sea) is preparation for something even greater (Peng flying south). Represents latent potential and changing perspectives.

abilities.name: Cosmic Transformation
abilities.description: Can shift between aquatic and aerial forms at will, changing fundamental nature.

abilities.name: Perspective Shift
abilities.description: Those who witness its transformation gain enlightenment about their own potential.

characters.cultural_impact: Influenced Chinese concepts of self-cultivation and transformation. Common in literary allusions.

characters.name: Yutu
title: Pharmacist of the Moon
Companion to Chang'e
Symbol of Longevity

appearance.form: White rabbit often standing upright. Jade fur that glows softly. Intelligent, kind eyes. Sometimes depicted with pestle and mortar.
appearance.moon_habitat: Lives in Moon Palace (广寒宫). Works under cassia tree that regenerates as it's chopped.
appearance.special_features: Immortal. Can communicate with mortals through dreams.

characters.mythological_role: Pounds elixir of immortality for Moon Goddess Chang'e and heavenly beings. Occasionally descends to cure plagues.

abilities.name: Elixir Crafting
abilities.description: Can create panaceas and longevity potions from lunar ingredients.

abilities.name: Dream Messaging
abilities.description: Appears in dreams of healers to transmit medical knowledge.

characters.festival_association: Mid-Autumn Festival - people see rabbit shape in moon.

characters.name: Nian
title: Ancient Scourge
Seasonal Predator
Reason for Traditions

appearance.head: Lion-like with ox horns. Large mouth with sharp teeth. Eyes sensitive to bright colors/lights.
appearance.body: Size of bull with scales. Loud roar. Moves with surprising speed despite size.
appearance.special_features: Hibernates most of year. Only active around lunar new year. Weaknesses discovered by villagers.

characters.mythological_role: Ancient beast that terrorized villages every spring until its weaknesses (red, fire, loud noises) were discovered. Defeat celebration became Chinese New Year.

abilities.name: Seasonal Awakening
abilities.description: Emerges with spring, drawn to human settlements after winter hibernation.

abilities.name: Fear Induction
abilities.description: Roar causes paralyzing fear in humans and animals.

characters.legacy: Explains New Year traditions: red decorations (against Nian), firecrackers (scare Nian), lion dances (imitating Nian's defeat).

characters.name: Huli Jing
title: Shape-shifting Cultivator
Trickster Spirit
Ascension Seeker

appearance.fox_form: Fox with increasing tails (1 per century of cultivation). At nine tails: fur silver-white, eyes intelligent, aura powerful.
appearance.human_form: Beautiful human (usually female) with fox features subtly visible (slit pupils, pointed ears). Can vary appearance.
appearance.special_features: Fox pearl (修炼珠) contains cultivation power. Tails indicate power level.

characters.cultivation_system: Gains power through meditation, absorbing moonlight/yang energy, sometimes seducing humans for their vital essence. Seeks immortality and celestial status.

types.name: Good Huli Jing
types.description: Repays kindness, becomes guardian spirit, may marry human and bear special children.

types.name: Evil Huli Jing
types.description: Seduces and consumes life force, causes madness, possesses people.

types.name: Celestial Huli Jing
types.description: Achieved immortality, serves in heaven (like Daji who became goddess after redemption).

characters.name: San Zu Wu
title: Solar Charioteer
Sun Essence
Ten Suns Problem

appearance.form: Golden crow with three legs (two for standing, one for power). Plumage like molten gold. Eyes like solar flares.
appearance.size: Varies - can be normal crow size or enormous when carrying sun.
appearance.special_features: Radiates intense heat. Leaves fire trails. Third leg channels solar energy.

characters.mythological_role: Originally ten sun crows (children of solar goddess Xihe) who took turns crossing sky. When all ten emerged simultaneously causing drought, Houyi shot down nine.

abilities.name: Solar Manifestation
abilities.description: Can become or carry the sun across sky. Body temperature matches solar core.

abilities.name: Drought Causation
abilities.description: Presence evaporates water, withers plants if uncontrolled.

characters.current_status: One remains as our sun. The nine dead became nine springs of hot water.

series.name: Nine Sons of the Dragon (龙生九子)
series.origin: Dragon fathered nine sons with different mothers, each inheriting different traits
series.purpose: Architectural guardians, decorative motifs with specific protective functions

characters.name: Bixi
title: Bearer of Historical Records
Foundation Guardian

appearance.form: Turtle-like with dragon head. Strong shell for bearing weight. Often shown carrying stone tablet on back.
appearance.special_features: Exceptional strength for carrying. Shell inscriptions tell its history.

characters.purpose: Carries stone stelae with important inscriptions (historical records, edicts) in temples, palaces, graves.
characters.symbolic_meaning: Endurance, longevity, preservation of history and knowledge.

characters.name: Chiwen
title: Protector Against Fire
Rain Caller

appearance.form: Fish-dragon hybrid. Tail curves upward. Mouth wide open as if swallowing roof ridges.
appearance.special_features: Believed to summon rain to extinguish fires.

characters.purpose: Decorates roof ridge ends of important buildings to protect against fire.
characters.symbolic_meaning: Protection from disaster, especially fire. Water/rain association.

characters.name: Pulao
title: Amplifier of Sound
Bell Handle

appearance.form: Small dragon that likes to roar. Often depicted on bell handles.
appearance.special_features: Voice carries great distance when motivated.

characters.purpose: Decorates bells and gongs to make them louder. Likes sound, responds to ringing.
characters.symbolic_meaning: Communication, making one's voice heard, alertness.

characters.name: Bi'an
title: Guardian of Justice
Prison Warden

appearance.form: Tiger-dragon hybrid. Fierce expression. Often depicted on prison gates.
appearance.special_features: Can discern guilt. Intimidates the wicked.

characters.purpose: Decorates prison gates and courtrooms. Keeps prisoners in, wards off evil from legal proceedings.
characters.symbolic_meaning: Justice, law enforcement, discernment of guilt.

series.name: Classic of Mountains & Seas (山海经)
series.purpose: Catalog strange lands, creatures, and gods; possibly early geography mixed with myth

characters.name: Jiangshi
title: Restless Spirit
Victim of Improper Burial

appearance.form: Corpse in Qing dynasty official robes. Rigid arms outstretched. Moves by hopping due to rigor mortis.
appearance.special_features: Pale green skin. Long white hair and nails. Breathes out poisonous qi. Wears talisman on forehead that controls it.

creation_methods: Death by violence with unfinished business

abilities.name: Life Drain
abilities.description: Drains life force (qi) from living through breath or touch.

abilities.name: Supernatural Strength
abilities.description: Stronger than in life due to rigor mortis and dark energy.

characters.cultural_impact: Popular in Hong Kong cinema. Represents fear of improper death rituals.

characters.name: Bashe
title: Mountain-Sized Serpent
Devourer of Elephants

appearance.form: Python hundreds of feet long. Black with green patterns. Eyes like ponds. Mouth can unhinge to enormous size.
appearance.special_features: Takes three years to digest elephant. Regurgitated bones form hills.

characters.habitat: Ancient jungles and mountains in southern regions.

abilities.name: Engulfing Swallow
abilities.description: Can swallow creatures many times its apparent size through spatial manipulation.

abilities.name: Bone Excretion
abilities.description: Regurgitated bones petrify into mineral deposits.

characters.legend: Mentioned in Shan Hai Jing as snake that eats elephants, digests for three years. Possibly inspired by prehistoric snake fossils.

characters.name: Fusang Tree & Ten Suns
title: Home of Sun Crows
Axis Mundi of East

appearance.form: Giant mulberry tree thousands of feet tall. Grows in Eastern sea (or alternatively, in Mexico according to some theories).
appearance.special_features: Each branch hosts a sun. Tree pulses with solar energy.

characters.mythological_role: Ten sun crows roost here overnight. One departs each morning on solar journey. When all ten left simultaneously, caused great drought.
characters.cultural_significance: Early Chinese cosmology. Name Fusang later used for Japan and possibly the Americas in historical texts.

series.name: Divine Warriors & Legendary Heroes
series.origin: Myths of cultural heroes who battled monsters and established order
series.purpose: Explain origins of civilization, represent triumph of order over chaos

characters.name: Yinglong
title: Ancient Rain Deity
Dragon Who Helped Huangdi
Flood Controller

appearance.form: Dragon with fully developed wings (unusual among Chinese dragons). Ancient, scarred appearance. Beard white with age. Scales dulled from eons of service.
appearance.special_features: Wings allow flight without clouds. Older than most gods. Missing from current world (resting after flood control).

notable_deeds: Helped Yellow Emperor defeat Chi You by controlling weather
Used tail to carve out riverbeds during Great Flood to control waters
Assisted Yu the Great in flood control projects

abilities.name: Terrain Sculpting
abilities.description: Can carve land with tail and claws, creating rivers, valleys, and canals.

abilities.name: Strategic Weather Control
abilities.description: Precise meteorological manipulation for military or engineering purposes.

characters.current_status: Resting in southern quadrant after exhausting efforts. Will awaken for world-ending floods.

characters.name: Hou Yi
title: Savior from Drought
Marksman of Heaven
Husband of Moon Goddess

appearance.mortal_form: Tall, muscular archer with keen eyes. Simple hunter's attire. Divine bow that only he can draw.
appearance.special_features: Eyesight can spot sparrow from miles. Strength to draw heaven's bow.

notable_deeds: Shot down nine of ten suns to save world from drought
Killed various monsters terrorizing humanity (Yaoguai, giant beasts)
Received elixir of immortality but his wife Chang'e consumed it and fled to moon
characters.tragedy: Became tyrannical after losing wife. Eventually killed by disciples or poisoned arrow.

abilities.name: Perfect Archery
abilities.description: Never misses. Can hit celestial bodies and conceptual targets (like 'the essence of drought').

abilities.name: Monster Slaying
abilities.description: Specialized in killing supernatural creatures with crafted arrows.

characters.legacy: Represents both heroic sacrifice and tragic flaw. Cultural hero who saved world but couldn't save his marriage.

characters.name: Chi You
title: Chieftain of Nine Li Tribes
Inventor of Metal Weapons
Rival of Yellow Emperor

appearance.form: Giant with bronze/copper head, iron forehead. Four eyes, six arms. Bull horns. Sometimes depicted with bull hooves.
appearance.special_features: Can create fog and storms. Skin metallic. Commanded supernatural armies.

characters.historical_role: Legendary tribal chieftain who rebelled against Yellow Emperor. Battle of Zhuolu established Yellow Emperor's supremacy.
inventions: Possibly earliest forms of law and punishment

abilities.name: Weather Manipulation
abilities.description: Created impenetrable fog at Zhuolu, countered by Yellow Emperor's compass chariot.

abilities.name: Army Command
abilities.description: Led armies of demons, giants, and supernatural beings.

characters.legacy: Worshipped as war god and patron of weapon smiths. Some Miao and Hmong peoples consider him ancestor.
